RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats.summary:
The RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats dictionary of the WebRTC API is used to report statistics from a remote endpoint about its outbound RTP stream.
This will correspond to an inbound stream that is currently being received by the local object.

remarks.para: The statistics can be obtained by iterating the returned by until you find a report with the type of remote-outbound-rtp.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsCodecId.summary: The codecId property of the dictionary is a string that uniquely identifies the object that was inspected to produce the data in the for the {{Glossary("RTP")}} stream.

remarks.para: RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats and RTCCodecStats objects are correlated by iterating the to find the statistics objects where RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats.codecId is equal to .

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsCodecId.value: A string that contains the of the object that was inspected to produce the object associated with this RTP stream.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsLocalId.summary: The dictionary's localId property is a string which can be used to identify the object whose matches this value.

remarks.para: Together, these two objects provide statistics about the inbound and outbound sides of the same synchronization source (SSRC).

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsLocalId.value: A string which can be compared to the value of an object's property to see if the two represent statistics for each of the two sides of the same set of data received by the local peer.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTotalRoun.summary: NOTE Experimental The totalRoundTripTime property of the dictionary indicates the sum of all round trip time (RTT) measurements since the beginning of the session, in seconds.

remarks.para:
The individual round trip time is calculated based on RTCP timestamps in the DLRR report block of RTCP Sender Reports (SR).
The average RTT can be computed by dividing totalRoundTripTime by .

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTotalRoun.value: A number indicating the total round trip time for the session, in seconds.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTransport.summary: The transportId property of the dictionary is a string that uniquely identifies the associated statistics object for this RTP stream's underlying transport.

remarks.para: RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats and RTCTransportStats objects are correlated by iterating the to find the statistics objects where RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats.transportId is equal to .

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTransport.value: A string that contains the of the object that was inspected to produce the object associated with this RTP stream.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsKind.summary: The kind property of the dictionary is a string indicating whether the described {{Glossary("RTP")}} stream contains audio or video media.

remarks.para:
This string will always be the same as the of the object carried by the stream.
It will also match the statistics object's property's media type.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsKind.value: The kinds is always one of:

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsRoundTrip.summary: NOTE Experimental The roundTripTimeMeasurements property of the dictionary is a positive integer value that represents the total number valid round of trip time measurements received for this synchronizing source (SSRC).

remarks.para: The count can be used as a measure of the availability and reliability of round trip time measurement data.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsRoundTrip.value: A positive number indicating the number of valid round trip time measurements.This is the number of RTCP Sender Reports (SR) received for this SSRC that contain a "delay since last RR (DLRR)" field from which a valid round trip time can be derived (according to {{rfc("3611","DLRR Report Block", "4.5")}}).

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsSsrc.summary: The ssrc property of the dictionary contains a positive integer value that identifies the synchronization source (SSRC) of this stream of {{Glossary("RTP")}} packets.

remarks.para:
A source might be something like a microphone, or a mixer application that combines multiple sources.
All packets from the same source share the same time source and sequence space, and so can be ordered relative to each other.
Note that two streams with the same ssrc value refer to the same source.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsSsrc.value:
A positive 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the SSRC of the RTP packets whose statistics are covered by this object.The manner in which SSRC values are generated is not mandated by the specification, although it does make recommendations.
You should not make any assumptions based on the value of ssrc other than that any two objects with the same ssrc value refer to the same source.
See {{RFC("3550", "", "8")}} for additional information about ssrc.
NOTEThe specification includes an example that generates values for ssrc using MD5.
While not part of the standard, exactly, it is a good mechanism that may be used by some browsers; others may use other methods, such as random number generators.
Do not rely upon these values meaning anything other than "these objects are associated with the same source."

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsRemoteTim.summary:
The property remoteTimestamp indicates the timestamp on the remote peer at which these statistics were sent.
This differs from timestamp, which indicates the time at which the statistics were generated or received locally.
RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsRemoteTim.value:
A value indicating the timestamp on the remote peer at which it sent these statistics.
This is different from the value timestamp, which gives the time at which the statistics were generated or received by the local peer.If this property is present, it comes from the RTCP Sender Report (SR) block, which reflects the clock on the remote peer at the time the message was sent.
Keep in mind that this means the clock may not be synchronized with the local clock, and that both the current time and the pace at which the clock runs may differ to some extent.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsType.summary: The type property of the dictionary is a string with the value "remote-outbound-rtp".

remarks.para:
Different statistics are obtained by iterating the object returned by a call to .
The type indicates the set of statistics available through the object in a particular iteration step.
A value of "remote-outbound-rtp" indicates that the statistics available in the current step are those defined in .

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsId.summary: The id property of the dictionary is a string that uniquely identifies the object for which this object provides statistics.

remarks.para: Using the id, you can correlate this statistics object with others, in order to monitor statistics over time for a given WebRTC object, such as an , or an .

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsId.value: A string that uniquely identifies the object for which this RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStats object provides statistics.The format of the ID string is not defined by the specification, so you cannot reliably make any assumptions about the contents of the string, or assume that the format of the string will remain unchanged for a given object type.

RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTimestamp.summary: The timestamp property of the dictionary is a object specifying the time at which the data in the object was sampled.
RTCRemoteOutboundRtpStreamStatsTimestamp.value: A value indicating the time at which the activity described by the statistics in this object was recorded, in milliseconds elapsed since the beginning of January 1, 1970, UTC.The value should be accurate to within a few milliseconds but may not be entirely precise, either because of hardware or operating system limitations or because of fingerprinting protection in the form of reduced clock precision or accuracy.
